description: Health Data Interoperability and Infrastructure. A broad theme covering the structural challenges and proposed solutions for creating a connected health data ecosystem
quotes_json: [{"quote":"Despite policy progress from TEFCA, ONC certification, and FHIR APIs, the patient experience remains fragmented and the human workflow burden is largely unresolved","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0238"},{"quote":"The US healthcare system is built on a flawed foundation because its data are disparate","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0062"}]

description: Systemic Fragmentation and Data Silos. This theme describes the core problem of disconnected data systems and the negative consequences for care delivery
quotes_json: [{"quote":"The current healthcare system suffers from fractured information, causing inefficiency and frustration for everyone involved","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0069"},{"quote":"Data Silos & Lack of Interoperability: Fragmented data across EHRs and practice management systems prevents a holistic view needed for innovative applications","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0049"}]

description: Lack of EHR/EMR System Interoperability. This theme focuses on the failure of different Electronic Health Record systems to communicate with each other
quotes_json: [{"quote":"The primary cause of waste and fraud is information getting lost between different, non-communicating EMR systems","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0009"},{"quote":"Currently, systems used by local doctors, local hospitals, and general healthcare organizations cannot communicate with each other","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0100"}]

description: Fragmentation Across Care Settings. This theme discusses the data silos that exist between different types of healthcare facilities, such as hospitals, post-acute care, and dental offices
quotes_json: [{"quote":"The current healthcare system forces every provider (Home Health, Hospice, Hospital, Clinic) to have their own separate EMR software","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0024"},{"quote":"Oral health is siloed from national health IT and care coordination strategies, despite its connection to systemic health","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0137"}]

description: Fragmentation of Patient Portals. This theme addresses the patient frustration of having to use multiple, disconnected patient portals for different providers
quotes_json: [{"quote":"Expresses consistent frustration as a patient with needing multiple logins for various clinics, rather than a single portal containing all personal health records","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0088"},{"quote":"Medicare recipients need a way to link patient portals from all of their providers, regardless of the healthcare system they use","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0080"}]

description: Proposals for a Unified National Health Data System. This theme covers various proposals for creating a single, centralized, or unified system for health records at a national level
quotes_json: [{"quote":"To effectively manage the health of the US population and the complexities of the healthcare system, the data must be centralized","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0062"},{"quote":"The U.S. must re-architect health data as critical national infrastructure","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0196"}]

description: Calls for a Universal or Government-Owned EMR. This theme details specific proposals for a single, government-sponsored or owned Electronic Medical Record system
quotes_json: [{"quote":"All health systems should be required to use a single, government-sponsored electronic record software program","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0010"},{"quote":"CMS should provide one universal EMR for all provider types","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0024"}]

description: Calls for a Centralized National Health Data Repository. This theme describes proposals for a federally governed central repository for all health data, decoupled from individual vendor platforms
quotes_json: [{"quote":"The commenter proposes a single national database of personal health information","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0062"},{"quote":"Proposes a National Health Data Repository (NHDR): a secure, federally governed system of record that decouples core health data from vendor-defined platforms","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0196"}]

description: Proposals for Blockchain-Based Infrastructure. This theme captures suggestions to use blockchain or distributed ledger technology to create a secure, interoperable health data system
quotes_json: [{"quote":"Goliath Engineering proposes a blockchain-based framework to address these gaps","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0005"},{"quote":"Proposes the creation of a 'block-chained HEALTHCARE INTERNET, powered by Artificial Intelligence!'","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0115"}]

description: Proposals for Patient-Controlled Health Data Records or Vaults. This theme describes models where the patient holds their complete health data in a personal, portable record or vault
quotes_json: [{"quote":"Proposes a patient-centric healthcare system where the patient holds all their health data from every source in a private, personal 'vault.'","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0069"},{"quote":"A patient-controlled global medical record should be created to automatically preserve the original record, including all test results","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0270"}]

description: Technical Standards and Protocols. This theme covers the need for and specific proposals related to technical standards for data exchange, structure, and meaning
quotes_json: [{"quote":"Our organization has developed specifications for all relevant FHIR APIs","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0281"},{"quote":"CMS should prioritize the adoption and enforcement of open, standardized protocols for EHR exchange","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0131"}]

description: General Need for Open, Standards-Based APIs. This theme expresses the general need for open and standardized Application Programming Interfaces to enable interoperability
quotes_json: [{"quote":"CMS can encourage open APIs by tying reimbursement incentives and certification eligibility to the use of FHIR-based, open standards","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0099"},{"quote":"Mandate and enforce robust, standardized APIs (like FHIR) for both clinical and administrative/operational data without prohibitive costs","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0049"}]

description: Adoption and Expansion of FHIR. This theme focuses on the specific need to adopt, expand, and enforce the use of the HL7 FHIR standard
quotes_json: [{"quote":"Seamless data interoperability through continued adherence to and expansion of FHIR (Fast Healthcare Interoperability Resources) standards for secure, real-time data exchange","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0023"},{"quote":"Phase out document-based exchange and require exchange via FHIR APIs as soon as possible","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0243"}]

description: Expansion and Improvement of USCDI. This theme covers suggestions for improving and expanding the United States Core Data for Interoperability (USCDI)
quotes_json: [{"quote":"Expand the U.S. Core Data for Interoperability (USCDI) to include more behavioral health assessments beyond PHQ-9 and GAD-7","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0140"},{"quote":"While the United States Core Data for Interoperability (USCDI) meets basic public health needs, the 'floor' for data availability must be raised","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0139"}]

description: Need for Imaging Data Interoperability and Standards. This theme addresses the specific challenges and need for standards, like DICOM, for exchanging medical images
quotes_json: [{"quote":"Data quality can be improved by strengthening the standardization and interoperability of medical imaging data through broader adoption of the Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine (DICOM) standard","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0103"},{"quote":"Patient Imaging Records are difficult to access and transfer","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0245"}]

description: Need for High-Frequency and Streaming Data Standards. This theme focuses on the need for standards to handle high-resolution, continuous data from medical devices
quotes_json: [{"quote":"Add continuous waveforms and ≥1 Hz vitals to the USCDI and TEFCA by CY 2027","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0004"},{"quote":"A single bedside monitor produces 26 million data points per patient-day, but none of this currently flows through CMS-mandated APIs","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0004"}]

description: Need for Terminology and Ontology Standards. This theme details proposals for standardizing the vocabularies and data models used in health records, such as SNOMED CT and LOINC
quotes_json: [{"quote":"CMS should work with ASTP/ONC to integrate DICOM standards into the Certified Health IT program, requiring certified EHRs and Picture Archiving and Communication Systems (PACS) to support full DICOM functionality","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0103"},{"quote":"Promote the use of SNOMED CT’s Expression Constraint Language (ECL) and the Value Set Compose Language (VSCL) in healthcare applications","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0050"}]

description: A Protocol-Centric Approach. This theme argues for focusing on defining and enforcing open protocols for data exchange rather than mandating specific platforms
quotes_json: [{"quote":"CMS should learn from the internet's open architecture and focus on defining the 'how' (protocols) rather than the 'what' (platforms)","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0131"},{"quote":"CMS should prioritize the adoption and enforcement of open, standardized protocols for EHR exchange, rather than endorsing specific platforms or vendors","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0131"}]

description: Support for Event-Driven Architecture. This theme discusses the benefits of adopting real-time, event-driven data streaming platforms, like Apache Kafka, for the health ecosystem
quotes_json: [{"quote":"A data streaming platform can serve as a central nervous system, connecting legacy systems, multi-cloud environments, and on-premises data centers","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0235"},{"quote":"Patient Admission, Discharge, and Transfer (ADT) workflows can be transformed from error-prone batch processes into fluid, real-time data exchanges","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0235"}]

description: Health Information Exchange Networks. This theme covers the role, function, and improvement of networks designed to facilitate data exchange, such as HIEs and TEFCA
quotes_json: [{"quote":"A federally organized, singular PHR system is the best way to meet the RFI's goals","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0133"},{"quote":"Continue investment in trusted exchange frameworks and Qualified Health Information Networks (QHINs)","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0158"}]

description: Role and Limitations of Health Information Exchanges (HIEs). This theme discusses the value and challenges of state and regional Health Information Exchanges
quotes_json: [{"quote":"HIEs should serve as FHIR incubators, spearheading V2-to-FHIR and CDA-to-FHIR pilots and test-bedding US Core and USCDI+ implementations","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0050"},{"quote":"HIEs are limited because dental providers rarely participate","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0271"}]

description: Support and Recommendations for TEFCA. This theme captures feedback and suggestions for improving the Trusted Exchange Framework and Common Agreement (TEFCA)
quotes_json: [{"quote":"TEFCA is a critical step toward a unified, national health information exchange, but it needs stronger alignment with CMS-led payment reforms","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0286"},{"quote":"The Cigna Group urges ASTP to implement the Payment and Healthcare Operations Exchange Purposes (XPs) in TEFCA as soon as possible","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0243"}]

description: Proposals for a National Provider Directory. This theme covers calls for a single, nationwide directory of healthcare providers with accessible API endpoints
quotes_json: [{"quote":"A nationwide provider directory with FHIR endpoints and digital identity would deliver significant value to payers","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0046"},{"quote":"TMA supports a centralized, public directory of FHIR endpoints, indexed by NPI","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0237"}]

description: Data Quality and Integrity. This theme focuses on the accuracy, reliability, and trustworthiness of the data within health records
quotes_json: [{"quote":"There must be accountability for the integrity of the data used in decision-making","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0092"},{"quote":"The accuracy of current data sets is often unclear, and the ability to aggregate and share them securely needs improvement","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0283"}]

description: Concerns about Inaccurate or Falsified Data in Records. This theme highlights issues with incorrect, incomplete, or deliberately altered information in patient records
quotes_json: [{"quote":"Many patient records contain vast misinformation, errors, deliberate omissions, and fabricated information","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0219"},{"quote":"Some health organizations alter medical records, including test results and diagnoses, after a patient suffers a serious problem or dies","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0270"}]

description: Need for Data Provenance and Metadata Standards. This theme discusses the importance of tracking the origin and history of data to ensure its trustworthiness
quotes_json: [{"quote":"CMS should require structured metadata for every data point, identifying: Who/what generated the data...The context of generation...Technical specifications","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0214"},{"quote":"Require all exchanged clinical data to include standardized provenance metadata (source, timestamp, transformation history)","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0236"}]

description: Need for Standardized Data Correction Mechanisms. This theme focuses on the need for effective and standardized ways to correct errors in electronic health records
quotes_json: [{"quote":"Standardized methods are needed to correct erroneous information to prevent it from persisting and propagating across systems","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0237"},{"quote":"There must be a mechanism to completely remove incorrect data from all recipient systems","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0237"}]

description: Integration of Specific Data Types into the Ecosystem. This theme covers calls to ensure various specific types of health and health-related data are included in interoperability efforts
quotes_json: [{"quote":"Expand Blue Button 2.0 and DPC APIs to include SDOH, imaging metadata, and device telemetry data","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0277"},{"quote":"Expand the data scope to include images and dental records, incorporating standards like THOR","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0271"}]

description: Integration of Unstructured Data. This theme describes the importance and challenges of making unstructured data like notes, faxes, and PDFs accessible via APIs
quotes_json: [{"quote":"Full access to all EHR data formats (including scanned documents, free-text notes, and sensor data) is crucial for comprehensive care","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0003"},{"quote":"The majority of clinically relevant information... is trapped in unstructured clinical notes and image files","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0126"}]

description: Integration of Social Determinants of Health (SDOH) Data. This theme focuses on the need to incorporate data on social risk factors into the health data ecosystem
quotes_json: [{"quote":"Social Determinants of Health (SDOH) should be treated as a strategic lever within value-based care (VBC), not a siloed, referral-driven initiative","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0247"},{"quote":"Expand data available via Blue Button and FHIR interfaces to include non-clinical domains such as food insecurity, housing instability, financial strain, and transportation","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0247"}]

description: Integration of Oral Health Data. This theme highlights the need to bridge the data silo between medical and dental health records
quotes_json: [{"quote":"Fully supports the interoperability of oral health data with physical health data","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0193"},{"quote":"It is necessary to create interoperability and data access that bridges the current silos between dentistry and other areas of healthcare","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0205"}]

description: Integration of Behavioral Health Data. This theme covers the specific need to integrate behavioral and mental health data and address associated privacy concerns
quotes_json: [{"quote":"Expand the U.S. Core Data for Interoperability (USCDI) to include more behavioral health assessments","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0140"},{"quote":"Provide clearer guidance for exchanging behavioral health information while upholding privacy protections under 42 CFR Part 2","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0140"}]

description: Integration of Public Health Data. This theme discusses the importance of including public health agencies and their data needs within the national health IT ecosystem
quotes_json: [{"quote":"The future health IT ecosystem must integrate public health perspectives","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0139"},{"quote":"Include non-CMS data from the CDC in the API","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0245"}]

description: Integration of Pharmacy and PBM Data. This theme addresses the need for better access to and interoperability with pharmacy and prescription data
quotes_json: [{"quote":"Strongly recommends ONC and CMS work to expand provider API capabilities to include prescription drug and/or covered outpatient drug information","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0151"},{"quote":"Comprehensive prescription fill history and adherence data for medication reconciliation and predicting adverse events","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0256"}]

description: Integration of Genomics Data. This theme covers the need for standards and infrastructure to support the interoperable exchange of genomic data
quotes_json: [{"quote":"Scale genomics data sharing across API-enabled Certified EHR Technology (CEHRT)","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0254"},{"quote":"CMS, ONC, and NLM should sign a collaborative agreement with the Global Alliance for Genomics and Health (GA4GH)","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0254"}]

description: Integration of Patient-Generated and Device Data. This theme focuses on incorporating data from patient wearables, remote monitoring devices, and other patient-reported sources
quotes_json: [{"quote":"CMS should develop guidance for health professionals on the appropriate collection and use of patient-generated health data","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0240"},{"quote":"A condition of the contract must be that the patient's health information is transmitted to a Medicare data bank","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0059"}]

description: Digital Health Products and Technologies. This theme captures comments about the development, features, adoption, and impact of specific digital health tools and technologies
quotes_json: [{"quote":"Drive the development and adoption of digital health management and care navigation applications","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0213"},{"quote":"Digital health innovations like smart medication devices and monitoring platforms can address nonadherence","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0064"}]

description: Development and Adoption of Digital Health Tools. This theme covers high-level issues related to the creation, evaluation, and use of digital health products
quotes_json: [{"quote":"To spur developer interest (TD-1) and increase patient/provider trust (PC-5a)","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0132"},{"quote":"CMS should explicitly include PERS and monitoring services in its definition and review of digital health tools","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0142"}]

description: Stimulating Developer Interest and Innovation. This theme focuses on what CMS can do to encourage the development of new digital health products
quotes_json: [{"quote":"CMS should launch an interoperability sandbox where developers can test applications against real-world data standards","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0046"},{"quote":"CMS should create clearer, more streamlined approval processes and regulatory pathways","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0256"}]

description: Need for Evaluation and Certification of Digital Tools. This theme covers proposals for CMS or other bodies to review, certify, or endorse digital health apps and tools
quotes_json: [{"quote":"CMS should act as a signaler of quality by maintaining a “Trusted CMS-Connected” registry for apps","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0046"},{"quote":"A national process is needed to evaluate and certify health apps for patient use","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0236"}]

description: Barriers to Provider Adoption of Digital Tools. This theme describes the obstacles that prevent clinicians and healthcare organizations from using new digital health products
quotes_json: [{"quote":"Primary barriers to adoption include workflow disruption, poor EHR integration, and insufficient incentives","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0087"},{"quote":"Providers will not use tools that require separate logins or duplicative documentation","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0160"}]

description: Patient and Caregiver Applications. This theme focuses on the features, functions, and types of applications designed for use by patients and their caregivers
quotes_json: [{"quote":"Patients need integrated health apps","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0087"},{"quote":"Digital health apps, like Cair, that help patients manage dental records are needed because most care navigation tools ignore oral health","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0271"}]

description: Desired Features for Health Management Apps. This theme details the specific functionalities that commenters want to see in patient-facing health applications
quotes_json: [{"quote":"View all data (claims, notes, imaging, labs) in a single location","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0087"},{"quote":"Apps should provide a comprehensive view of health needs and actionable steps","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0281"}]

description: Need for AI-Powered Personal Health Assistants. This theme covers proposals for intelligent digital assistants or
quotes_json: [{"quote":"The most impactful apps would function as 'virtual care navigators,' offering real-time, longitudinal access to clinical, behavioral, and benefit data in a single, AI-powered interface","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0046"},{"quote":"A digital assistant should...Track and alert on trends in key clinical metrics","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0050"}]

description: Specific Focus on Caregiver-Centric Tools. This theme highlights the unique need for digital tools designed to support family caregivers
quotes_json: [{"quote":"A critical opportunity exists to better support family caregivers","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0089"},{"quote":"A 'Caregiver Dashboard' To allow authorized loved ones to view a beneficiary’s care journey and receive alerts","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0155"}]

description: Proposals for Specific Commercial Products. This theme collects comments that advocate for or mention specific, named commercial products or platforms
quotes_json: [{"quote":"The commenter recommends using the 'Counterpart Assistant' created by Clover Health","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0012"},{"quote":"Recommends the 'Addison Care' system from Electronic Caregiver (ECG)","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0078"}]

description: Artificial Intelligence (AI) in Healthcare. This theme covers all aspects of using Artificial Intelligence, including its benefits, risks, and specific applications
quotes_json: [{"quote":"AI in healthcare is necessary to improve availability, cost, and accessibility for the general population","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0074"},{"quote":"The future health technology ecosystem must instead support the sharing of data and knowledge needed to treat the numerous small, nationally-distributed patient clusters","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0283"}]

description: Support for AI to Improve Care and Efficiency. This theme captures general support for using AI to improve diagnostics, automate tasks, and enhance care delivery
quotes_json: [{"quote":"Clinical AI has the potential to improve documentation integrity, care quality, and operational efficiency","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0021"},{"quote":"Recommends using AI to perform automated clinical record reviews","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0018"}]

description: Need for AI Governance, Safety, and Oversight. This theme focuses on the risks of AI and the need for guardrails, safety testing, and clear governance frameworks
quotes_json: [{"quote":"AI systems must be used with caution due to several risks","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0021"},{"quote":"CMS must explicitly address: When explainable AI (XAI) is mandatory...How premarket approval and post-market surveillance of AI systems will be conducted","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0214"}]

description: Specific AI Use Cases and Platforms. This theme details specific proposed applications of AI, such as for clinical decision support, risk adjustment, or patient communication
quotes_json: [{"quote":"The platform uses AI-powered, empathic digital avatars to simulate real-world conversations and improve patient-provider communication","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0178"},{"quote":"Proposes to provide its 'Qualifications' product and ICD-10 code extraction model directly to the CMS RADV audit team","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0097"}]

description: Using AI to Address Administrative Burden. This theme highlights the potential for AI to automate and streamline administrative tasks in healthcare
quotes_json: [{"quote":"AI voice agents can handle inbound calls to HHS/DSS offices to answer high-volume questions about application status, eligibility, documents, and timelines","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0191"},{"quote":"The AI platform integrates with Electronic Health Records (EHRs), payer systems, and contact center CRMs","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0068"}]

description: Remote Monitoring and Wearable Technology. This theme covers technologies used to monitor patients outside of traditional clinical settings
quotes_json: [{"quote":"The future of medicine lies with electronic medical devices and wearables","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0040"},{"quote":"Remote Therapeutic Monitoring (RTM) is a promising framework for medication adherence","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0064"}]

description: General Support for Remote Monitoring. This theme captures broad support for the use and expansion of remote patient and therapeutic monitoring
quotes_json: [{"quote":"Patients and caregivers benefit from digital tools like remote patient monitoring (RPM) that provide real-time, actionable health insights","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0286"},{"quote":"Examples include: remote patient monitoring (RPM), telehealth platforms, wearable devices, and AI-driven decision-support tools","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0023"}]

description: Specific Device Proposals and Use Cases. This theme describes specific remote monitoring devices and their applications, such as for glucose monitoring or emergency response
quotes_json: [{"quote":"Continuous glucose monitors (CGMs) should be made widely available to Medicare patients with diabetes","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0035"},{"quote":"CMS should explicitly include PERS [Personal Emergency Response Services] and monitoring services in its definition and review of digital health tools","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0142"}]

description: Need for Higher Reimbursement for Remote Monitoring. This theme focuses on the argument that payment rates for remote monitoring services are too low to sustain adoption
quotes_json: [{"quote":"Higher reimbursement for Remote Patient Monitoring (RPM) and Remote Therapeutic Monitoring (RTM) codes is necessary","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0040"},{"quote":"Average Medicare reimbursement for RM has decreased 7-28% since 2019, making these services unsustainable for providers","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0272"}]

description: Digital Therapeutics (DTx). This theme covers software-based treatments, their benefits, and the need for supportive policies
quotes_json: [{"quote":"Digital therapeutics (DTx) represent a vital, evidence-based solution for maternal mental health (MMH) that can be seamlessly integrated into the continuum of care","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0130"},{"quote":"Widespread adoption of these technologies could save over $1 trillion annually while improving health outcomes and access","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0063"}]

description: Proposals for
quotes_json: [{"quote":"Proposes 'Digital Step Therapy' as a modern framework for payers to adopt PDTs in a cost-effective, evidence-based manner","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0063"},{"quote":"Under this model, patients would start with an FDA-cleared digital therapeutic as a first-line treatment before escalating to more costly interventions","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0063"}]

description: Policy, Reimbursement, and Regulation. This theme covers comments related to government policy, payment rules, and the broader regulatory landscape for healthcare and health technology
quotes_json: [{"quote":"CMS should lead the industry by reframing this layer not as 'tech' or 'admin,' but as billable, clinical infrastructure","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0056"},{"quote":"Previous health IT regulations have failed because they layer new compliance requirements on a fragmented digital foundation","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0095"}]

description: Reimbursement and Payment Models. This theme addresses how healthcare services and technologies are paid for, including critiques of current models and proposals for new ones
quotes_json: [{"quote":"Current reimbursement models have not kept pace with innovation in the digital health sector","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0055"},{"quote":"To meet the realities of modern healthcare, CMS should create a reimbursement pathway for 'Distributed Clinical Logic' (DCL)","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0056"}]

description: Need for Clear Reimbursement Pathways for Digital Health. This theme highlights the lack of clear and consistent payment policies for digital health tools, which hinders their adoption
quotes_json: [{"quote":"Promising technologies like remote monitoring, AI-driven diagnostics, and digital therapeutics face significant adoption barriers due to unclear or inconsistent reimbursement pathways","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0055"},{"quote":"Lack of clear reimbursement pathways and coverage policies for wearables is a significant barrier to provider adoption and patient access","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0003"}]

description: Aligning Value-Based Care Incentives with Technology Adoption. This theme covers suggestions to use value-based payment models to encourage the use of effective digital health technologies
quotes_json: [{"quote":"CMS should offer enhanced shared savings, infrastructure payments, and performance bonuses to APMs that integrate certified digital health tools","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0046"},{"quote":"A portion of ACO shared savings bonuses should be tied to interoperability engagement (e.g., FHIR adoption, PIQI compliance)","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0050"}]

description: Critiques and Suggestions for Value-Based Care (VBC). This theme captures criticisms of current VBC models and suggestions for their improvement
quotes_json: [{"quote":"The term 'value-based care' (VBC) is too generic","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0042"},{"quote":"Current value-based care reimbursement structures place undue risk on providers, who have insufficient control over patient adherence and outcomes","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0122"}]

description: Proposals to Reform Specific Payment Models. This theme contains suggestions for changing specific Alternative Payment Models or bundled payments
quotes_json: [{"quote":"The 90-day episode of care for spinal fusion should be extended to a minimum of 180 days","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0215"},{"quote":"CMS currently restricts MDPP [Medicare Diabetes Prevention Program] to in-person programs, unlike the CDC which recognizes virtual suppliers","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0272"}]

description: Information Blocking. This theme details the problem of entities interfering with the access, exchange, or use of electronic health information
quotes_json: [{"quote":"The ACC continues to hear from members about the 'weaponization of EHRs and contracts as a competitive weapon.'","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0151"},{"quote":"Payer delays in sharing MA claims and health data, sometimes by as much as six months, are a significant barrier to effective plan optimization","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0008"}]

description: Experiences with Information Blocking. This theme captures firsthand accounts and examples of information blocking practices
quotes_json: [{"quote":"The commenter, a patient with Parkinson's and related memory problems, nearly lost his disability benefits due to an inability to access his medical records from two providers","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0188"},{"quote":"Some OEMs charge up to $8,000/bed/year for 'unlock keys' and use warranty threats to create contractual lock-in","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0004"}]

description: Concerns about Anti-Competitive Practices. This theme focuses on the use of information blocking as a tool to stifle competition and create vendor lock-in
quotes_json: [{"quote":"Information blocking (via fees, complex requirements) is a consequence of trying to derive value from flawed 'big data.'","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0153"},{"quote":"Declare that OEM clauses voiding warranties or demanding 'unlock-fees' for raw data access are *per se* information blocking","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0004"}]

description: Calls for Stronger Enforcement and Penalties. This theme contains demands for more aggressive enforcement of information blocking rules and stronger penalties for violators
quotes_json: [{"quote":"HHS must demonstrate that the HHS Office of Inspector General (OIG) will enforce information blocking regulations","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0243"},{"quote":"Implement stricter enforcement with escalating penalties","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0097"}]

description: Recommendations to Revise or Add Exceptions. This theme details suggestions to change the existing information blocking exceptions to prevent abuse or add new ones
quotes_json: [{"quote":"Add a new exception allowing clinicians to hold sensitive test results (e.g., cancer diagnosis, genetic markers) for three business days before releasing them to the patient portal","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0236"},{"quote":"ONC should remove or revise the information blocking exceptions, which are currently exploited by EMR companies as anti-competitive shields","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0280"}]

description: Need to Improve the Complaint Reporting Process. This theme addresses the perceived failures of the current system for reporting and resolving information blocking complaints
quotes_json: [{"quote":"The Office of the National Coordinator (ONC) is known as 'the place where complaints go to die,' as they are rarely investigated","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0280"},{"quote":"His wife filed two complaints on the ONC/ASTP information blocking website...They never received confirmation of the submissions, nor any follow-up or resolution","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0188"}]

description: Program Integrity and Market Conduct. This theme covers issues related to fraud, waste, abuse, and improper marketing practices in healthcare programs
quotes_json: [{"quote":"An AI-enabled fraud surveillance infrastructure can reduce improper payments and protect trust fund solvency","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0109"},{"quote":"The problem with Medicare marketing is not the technology; it is the process","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0114"}]

description: Using Technology to Prevent Fraud, Waste, and Abuse (FWA). This theme describes proposals to use technology like AI and blockchain to proactively detect and prevent FWA
quotes_json: [{"quote":"CMS could use AI to complete audits for fraud, waste, and abuse, performing desk audits before needing to go on-site","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0024"},{"quote":"The system prevents fraud at the point of transaction, avoiding costly 'pay and chase' recovery","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0005"}]

description: Concerns about Medicare Marketing and Churning. This theme addresses issues with unsolicited telemarketing and frequent plan switching by beneficiaries
quotes_json: [{"quote":"Medicare beneficiaries are stressed by unsolicited robocalls from third-party insurance companies","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0071"},{"quote":"The primary issues are: Call centers that constantly cold-call seniors about their Medicare coverage...Year-round Special Election Periods (SEPs) that enable beneficiaries to change plans at any time","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0114"}]

description: Concerns about Pharmacy Benefit Manager (PBM) Practices. This theme captures criticism of PBMs, calling for greater transparency and fiduciary responsibility
quotes_json: [{"quote":"Recommends that CMS remove Pharmacy Benefit Managers (PBMs) from all contact with the agency if they... are not transparent [and] do not function in a fiduciary model","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0117"},{"quote":"The market concentration of national pharmacy claims processing within a single entity [PBM]","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0134"}]

description: Administrative and Regulatory Burden. This theme covers the negative impacts of excessive regulations and administrative tasks on providers and the healthcare system
quotes_json: [{"quote":"Physicians spend 15.5 hours weekly on paperwork","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0095"},{"quote":"Reducing administrative burdens in RCM is critical to address physician burnout and support IPPs","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0122"}]

description: General Concerns about Excessive Regulation. This theme captures broad statements about the negative effects of government regulation on healthcare
quotes_json: [{"quote":"The government should reduce its regulatory burden on healthcare providers","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0020"},{"quote":"Excessive regulation negatively impacts the healthcare system in several ways: It stifles patient care...It stifles innovation","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0020"}]

description: Burden of Quality Reporting. This theme describes the administrative burden associated with clinical quality data collection and reporting
quotes_json: [{"quote":"Annual updates to quality measurement reporting are challenging for practices to review, implement, and optimize","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0159"},{"quote":"Despite Certified EHR Technology (CEHRT) requirements, many EHR vendors fail to provide timely, usable, and affordable Quality Reporting Document Architecture (QRDA I) files","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0136"}]

description: Burden of Prior Authorization. This theme focuses on the administrative costs and care delays caused by prior authorization requirements
quotes_json: [{"quote":"Voices strong concern and opposition to the ever-growing use of prior authorization requirements","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0151"},{"quote":"AAN members cite prior authorization burdens as a top administrative concern that leads to care delays and serious adverse events","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0159"}]

description: Burden of EHR and OASIS Documentation. This theme details the excessive time and effort required for clinical documentation in EHRs, particularly the OASIS assessment in home health
quotes_json: [{"quote":"The paperwork/charting burden for care providers has exponentially increased with each new platform implementation","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0157"},{"quote":"For home health, CMS should reduce the OASIS assessment to include only meaningful data and eliminate duplication","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0058"}]

description: Specific Medicare and Medicaid Program Issues. This theme covers feedback on the rules, processes, and tools of specific government health programs
quotes_json: [{"quote":"The requirement to enroll in Medicare A and B at age 65 should be eliminated for those who are still working and have primary private insurance","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0002"},{"quote":"Proposes a new food pyramid and educating seniors on using food and natural herbs as preventative medicine","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0044"}]

description: Calls to Modernize Medicare Enrollment and Plan Selection. This theme addresses problems with Medicare enrollment rules, penalties, and the process for choosing plans
quotes_json: [{"quote":"The lifelong late enrollment penalty is a significant financial burden on seniors and the disabled","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0002"},{"quote":"Unlike the Affordable Care Act Marketplace, Medicare is a Closed System—And That’s Hurting Beneficiaries","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0102"}]

description: Critiques of Medicare Advantage Plans. This theme captures negative feedback about the functioning and oversight of Medicare Advantage plans
quotes_json: [{"quote":"Medicare Advantage plans are not working as intended and often deny entitled care","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0002"},{"quote":"The push for privatization and technology-driven changes via Medicare Advantage plans is a bad idea","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0098"}]

description: Need to Improve Medicare.gov Usability. This theme focuses on the difficulty beneficiaries have using the official Medicare website, particularly for plan selection
quotes_json: [{"quote":"Many Medicare beneficiaries have difficulty using the Medicare.gov website to select their primary care physician","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0067"},{"quote":"The Medicare.gov plan finder tool needs to be updated to clearly indicate which drugs are covered under Part B","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0011"}]

description: Issues with Medicare-Workers' Compensation Conflicts. This theme highlights cases where beneficiaries are denied Medicare services due to open Workers' Compensation claims
quotes_json: [{"quote":"CMS and the Workers' Compensation industry must make it a top priority to resolve issues where beneficiaries are denied medical treatment due to open WC claims","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0032"},{"quote":"In a recent, specific case, a Medicare beneficiary was removed from an organ donation waitlist due to an open WC claim","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0032"}]

description: Calls to Automate Medicaid Renewals. This theme focuses on proposals to replace paper-based Medicaid redetermination processes with automated, digital solutions
quotes_json: [{"quote":"Urges CMS to prioritize bold, actionable policy to reduce administrative waste and improve the beneficiary experience in Medicaid and Medicare renewals","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0076"},{"quote":"CMS should encourage and fund solutions that...Auto-populate renewal forms with existing eligibility data from programs like SNAP, TANF, and SSA","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0076"}]

description: Need for Consistent Cross-Agency Terminology and Strategy. This theme highlights the confusion caused by inconsistent definitions and a lack of coordination across federal agencies
quotes_json: [{"quote":"Federal agencies and the private sector use many varying definitions of 'digital health.'","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0017"},{"quote":"HHS should strengthen coordination on health data interoperability across all its agencies and with other federal departments","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0243"}]

description: Procedural Requests. This theme captures direct requests to the agency regarding the public comment process itself
quotes_json: [{"quote":"The regulation affects numerous stakeholders within a complex healthcare ecosystem","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0112"},{"quote":"Requests that CMS extend the public comment deadline","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0112"}]

description: Requests for Meeting Materials. This theme covers specific requests for access to recordings or other materials from public meetings
quotes_json: [{"quote":"Requests that the agency share a recording of the Q&A session associated with the Request for Information (RFI)","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0053"}]

description: Patient, Caregiver, and Provider Experience. This theme groups comments focused on the human-centered aspects of healthcare, including access, usability, equity, and support for specific populations
quotes_json: [{"quote":"The benefits of digital health will not be realized if they don't reach vulnerable populations","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0055"},{"quote":"Prioritize input from Medicare beneficiaries and caregivers","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0279"}]

description: Digital Access and Equity (The Digital Divide). This theme describes the barriers that prevent certain populations from using and benefiting from digital health technologies
quotes_json: [{"quote":"Digital health technology must be designed for everyone, including low-income individuals who may lack high-speed internet, smartphones, or advanced tech skills","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0047"},{"quote":"A 2020 study found 26.3% of Medicare beneficiaries lacked access to either a computer with high-speed internet or a smartphone with a data plan","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0279"}]

description: Lack of Internet and Device Access. This theme focuses on the foundational barrier of not having reliable internet or the necessary devices to use digital tools
quotes_json: [{"quote":"Over 20 million Americans, particularly those with lower incomes, older adults, and those in rural areas, lack access to high-speed internet","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0017"},{"quote":"Many people in rural areas lack access to PCs and do not have cell coverage, making digital health apps impractical","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0058"}]

description: Need for Digital Literacy and Technical Support. This theme covers the importance of training and assistance to help people, especially seniors, use health technology effectively
quotes_json: [{"quote":"People will not use digital health technologies effectively if they do not understand what they are, how they are used, and how they can support their health","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0017"},{"quote":"CMS should offer short classes at local libraries to assist beneficiaries","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0128"}]

description: Calls for Accessible and User-Friendly Design. This theme emphasizes the need for digital health tools to be simple, intuitive, and designed for diverse user abilities
quotes_json: [{"quote":"The system should be simple and intuitive, like a 'Jitterbug phone and not like the iPhone'","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0002"},{"quote":"To make digital health products accessible, especially for users with limited digital experience, CMS should prioritize simple, intuitive design","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0155"}]

description: Patient Data Access, Control, and Rights. This theme focuses on the ability of patients to see, manage, and control their own health information
quotes_json: [{"quote":"The patient's chart and data belong to the patient","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0280"},{"quote":"Data sharing between public and private insurance will not happen unless patients are given legal rights that grant them control and authority over how their data is used","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0101"}]

description: Difficulties Accessing Complete Personal Health Records. This theme describes the challenges patients face in obtaining a full copy of their medical records
quotes_json: [{"quote":"As a caregiver... I have found it very difficult to gather and share her medical records","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0072"},{"quote":"Patients are currently blocked from participating in their own record-keeping","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0219"}]

description: Demand for Patient Control Over Health Data. This theme captures the strong desire for patients to have ownership and control over who can access and use their health information
quotes_json: [{"quote":"Patients, not vendors or health systems, should 'own' their data and grant access","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0107"},{"quote":"Patients should be given control to keep their own records private","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0135"}]

description: Requests for Patient Access to Audit Logs. This theme focuses on the specific demand for patients to be able to see who has accessed their health records
quotes_json: [{"quote":"Strongly supports regulatory action to require healthcare systems to provide patients with transparent, real-time access to audit logs","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0041"},{"quote":"Individuals must have the right to audit who has accessed their health information","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0061"}]

description: Concerns about Cost for Accessing Records or Images. This theme addresses instances where patients are charged fees to obtain copies of their own medical records or images
quotes_json: [{"quote":"Cites a recent experience where a provider charged a $10 fee to put MRI films on a disc","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0070"},{"quote":"Recommends that providers be required to provide a copy of a patient's films for free","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0070"}]

description: Specific Population Needs and Perspectives. This theme groups comments that address the unique challenges and needs of specific demographic or patient groups
quotes_json: [{"quote":"As the Baby Boomer generation ages, chronic conditions will become more prevalent","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0019"},{"quote":"HHS should prioritize investment and standards development in nutrition, sleep, and mental health to enable digital health companies to deliver whole-person care","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0054"}]

description: Needs of Seniors and the Elderly. This theme focuses on the particular challenges faced by older adults when interacting with the healthcare and technology systems
quotes_json: [{"quote":"The idea that elderly patients will want and use technology-based services to manage their healthcare is ridiculous","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0098"},{"quote":"Many seniors face challenges adopting digital health tools due to limited digital literacy, cognitive impairments, and physical disabilities","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0019"}]

description: Needs of Individuals with Disabilities. This theme highlights the accessibility challenges for people with physical or cognitive disabilities
quotes_json: [{"quote":"Traveling to medical appointments is difficult for the commenter, who has Cerebral Palsy and uses a wheelchair","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0006"},{"quote":"As a senior and disabled Medicare patient, telehealth has been instrumental in my healthcare","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0036"}]

description: Needs of Rural Populations. This theme describes the unique barriers to healthcare and technology adoption faced by people in rural areas
quotes_json: [{"quote":"The primary obstacles are cost and lack of reliable internet","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0066"},{"quote":"Rural and small home-based care providers experience unique challenges","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0274"}]

description: Needs of Justice-Impacted Individuals. This theme focuses on the importance of care continuity and data access for people reentering the community after incarceration
quotes_json: [{"quote":"Improving continuity of care at reentry through technology can reduce inefficiency, support public safety, save costs, and improve health management","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0241"},{"quote":"Health information from incarceration is historically siloed from community health data","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0241"}]

description: Needs of Patients with Complex or Multiple Chronic Conditions. This theme addresses the challenges of managing care for patients with multiple comorbidities
quotes_json: [{"quote":"The most complex 35% of Medicare patients account for approximately 80% of program expenditures","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0283"},{"quote":"A single, unified portal would be most valuable for...Managing multiple chronic conditions","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0046"}]

description: Needs of Maternal Health Patients. This theme covers the specific data and technology needs related to maternal and fetal care
quotes_json: [{"quote":"The commenter urges CMS and ONC to explicitly prioritize maternal health in its digital health strategy","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0227"},{"quote":"Digital therapeutics (DTx) represent a vital, evidence-based solution for maternal mental health (MMH)","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0130"}]

description: Needs of Children and Pediatric Patients. This theme highlights the unique requirements for pediatric care, including data for autism and sepsis
quotes_json: [{"quote":"There is a severe lack of adequate support for children with autism in public schools","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0047"},{"quote":"Sepsis claims more children's lives than all childhood cancers combined, yet there is no federal sepsis performance measure for children","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0196"}]

description: Workforce and Training. This theme addresses issues related to the healthcare workforce, including shortages, training, and new support roles
quotes_json: [{"quote":"The increasing prevalence of diabetes requires specialized care, but there is a shortage of endocrinologists and diabetes nurse educators","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0019"},{"quote":"This technology is needed to help fill the void created by the growing shortage of healthcare workers","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0040"}]

description: Need for Clinician and Staff Education on Health IT. This theme focuses on the necessity of training healthcare professionals to effectively use and understand health IT standards and tools
quotes_json: [{"quote":"The greatest barrier to the success of FHIR-enabled interoperability is educational, not technical","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0149"},{"quote":"FHIR and CDA education should flow from the parent organizations...down to frontline staff","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0265"}]

description: Accurate Representation of Physician Associates (PAs). This theme highlights the need to accurately identify and list Physician Associates (PAs) in provider directories and data systems
quotes_json: [{"quote":"PAs are sometimes omitted from payer provider directories and must be explicitly included","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0240"},{"quote":"PAs should be identified in provider directories under the specialty in which they practice","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0240"}]

description: Proposal for a National Health Extension Service. This theme describes a proposal to create a local support system to help practices and patients adopt new technologies, modeled on agricultural extension services
quotes_json: [{"quote":"A national 'Health Extension Service' should be created, modeled after the successful agriculture extension service","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0084"},{"quote":"This is a 'shovel-ready' opportunity that CMS can lead","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0084"}]

description: Holistic and Preventive Care Approaches. This theme covers calls for a broader, more preventive, and holistic approach to healthcare within Medicare
quotes_json: [{"quote":"Supports a focus on disease prevention in Medicare","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0044"},{"quote":"Current health platforms are too focused on pharmaceutical care and do not support holistic or dietary needs","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0047"}]

description: Calls for a Focus on Prevention and Wellness. This theme captures general support for shifting Medicare's focus toward preventing disease rather than just treating it
quotes_json: [{"quote":"A healthy lifestyle is the recognized bedrock for managing nearly every serious chronic medical condition","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0059"},{"quote":"Focusing on health promotion and disease prevention will serve to limit the high cost of tertiary prevention","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0037"}]

description: Integrating Nutrition and Food-as-Medicine. This theme details proposals to incorporate nutrition education and
quotes_json: [{"quote":"Recommends focusing on nutrition and natural medicine","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0044"},{"quote":"CMS and ONC are strongly encouraged to recognize diet quality assessment as a vital, underutilized element of clinical care","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0152"}]

description: Integrating Non-Clinical Community Services. This theme discusses the need to connect clinical care with community-based organizations and social services
quotes_json: [{"quote":"To effectively manage chronic disease, patients must be connected to programs and services that exist outside the traditional healthcare system","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0127"},{"quote":"The system should define and support e-referrals to these non-clinical community organizations","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0127"}]

description: Privacy, Security, and Trust. This theme groups comments focused on the protection of patient data, individual autonomy, and trust in the healthcare system and its technologies
quotes_json: [{"quote":"Assurance of patient confidentiality should override the needs of health regulators","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0037"},{"quote":"A slow implementation is necessary due to significant trust issues with: new technology... new methodologies... the government itself","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0060"}]

description: Strong Opposition to Mandatory Digital Technologies. This theme captures the widespread and forceful opposition to any mandatory use of digital identification or tracking for healthcare access
quotes_json: [{"quote":"Opposes all medical mandates required to access society","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0194"},{"quote":"The commenter wants 'absolutely nothing' from the 'Health Technology Ecosystem' and states, 'I will not comply.'","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0239"}]

description: Opposition to Mandatory Digital IDs. This theme details the specific and strong opposition to requiring a digital ID for healthcare or societal participation
quotes_json: [{"quote":"There should be absolutely no digital ID requirement for any person to access healthcare in America, ever","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0168"},{"quote":"Rejects any form of digital ID for any purpose","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0192"}]

description: Opposition to Mandatory Biometric Data Collection. This theme captures comments explicitly opposing any requirement to provide biometric data to access healthcare
quotes_json: [{"quote":"No one should ever be forced to provide biometric data to access healthcare in America","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0200"},{"quote":"No one should be compelled to provide biometric data to access healthcare","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0174"}]

description: Opposition to Mandatory Wearable Devices. This theme focuses on opposition to any mandate requiring individuals to use wearable technology for health purposes
quotes_json: [{"quote":"Under no circumstances should wearable technology ever be mandated on any human for any healthcare purpose","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0168"},{"quote":"Wearable technology should never be mandated for any healthcare purpose","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0164"}]

description: Data Privacy and Consent. This theme covers concerns about the privacy of health information and the need for patient consent before data is shared or used
quotes_json: [{"quote":"My primary concern with health technology is patient privacy and parental rights","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0176"},{"quote":"Personally identifiable health information must remain private and should never be shared with any party without the individual's explicit consent","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0061"}]

description: Demand for Explicit Patient Consent for Data Sharing. This theme highlights the call for strict, opt-in consent from patients before their data is shared with any other entity
quotes_json: [{"quote":"Stop the practice of allowing providers to share patient information without explicit, direct consent","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0222"},{"quote":"Informed consent must always be the standard","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0176"}]

description: Calls for a
quotes_json: [{"quote":"Everyone should have a 'right to be forgotten'","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0164"},{"quote":"If AI or other technological tools are used to gather patient data, the individual must have the right to decide if that data is stored or deleted","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0202"}]

description: Concerns about Data Sharing with Third Parties. This theme addresses worries about health data being shared with or sold to commercial or other third-party entities
quotes_json: [{"quote":"This position is based on historical precedent where private data aggregation and advertising/marketing companies have used and abused consumer data without the consumer's knowledge or consent","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0185"},{"quote":"If a patient pays a co-pay with a Visa card, the doctor's office should not share any information with Visa, Experian, TransUnion, or similar entities","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0061"}]

description: Concerns about Government Surveillance and Data Misuse. This theme details fears that a national health data system could be used for government surveillance or political targeting
quotes_json: [{"quote":"Creating a seamless government data trove by streamlining healthcare, ID, and IRS records is a problem for freedom and privacy","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0171"},{"quote":"Fears that certain administrations will use this information to target their political 'opponents.'","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0171"}]

description: Cybersecurity. This theme covers concerns about the security of digital health systems and the risk of data breaches
quotes_json: [{"quote":"Technology used for digital health must be scrutinized and hardened to make hacking nearly impossible","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0061"},{"quote":"High-profile privacy violations and hacking incidents make consumers and providers reluctant to use digital health tools","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0017"}]

description: Concerns about Hacking and Data Breaches. This theme focuses on the general fear and consequences of health data being stolen by hackers
quotes_json: [{"quote":"Data theft is not the result of sophisticated hacking on the 'dark web,' but rather of 'careless, lazy, selfish' healthcare facilities letting their guard down","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0116"},{"quote":"The Change Healthcare (Feb 2024): A ransomware attack affected 190 million patients, disrupted U.S. pharmacies for months","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0134"}]

description: Need for Stronger Cybersecurity Measures. This theme includes calls for better security practices and infrastructure to protect health data
quotes_json: [{"quote":"Adherence to cybersecurity best practices is essential throughout the development and use of digital health apps","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0017"},{"quote":"The U.S. healthcare system is fragile due to its dependence on interconnected IT systems","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0134"}]

description: Proposals for Zero-Trust Architecture. This theme captures suggestions to implement a
quotes_json: [{"quote":"The system maintains HIPAA compliance and implements a zero-trust architecture","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0007"},{"quote":"A zero-trust data layer with a dynamic AI Gateway enforces PII detection, RBAC, audit logging, and compliance","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0057"}]

description: Issues of Trust. This theme describes a fundamental lack of trust in various actors within the healthcare ecosystem, from government to technology vendors
quotes_json: [{"quote":"A slow implementation is necessary due to significant trust issues with: new technology, new methodologies, the government itself","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0060"},{"quote":"Trust must be developed between CMS, providers, payers, and public health entities","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0139"}]

description: General Distrust in Government and Technology. This theme captures broad skepticism and distrust toward government initiatives and new technologies
quotes_json: [{"quote":"The commenter is uncomfortable with their personal medical files being digitized and stored outside their doctor's office","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0229"},{"quote":"This RFI is a 'dog and pony show' because CMS is already building the digital infrastructure","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0267"}]

description: Concerns about AI Reliability and Bias. This theme focuses on skepticism regarding the accuracy, fairness, and reliability of artificial intelligence
quotes_json: [{"quote":"AI should be used to assist clinicians, not replace medical judgment","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0159"},{"quote":"Reliance on AI without human clinical oversight could undermine professional judgment and introduce unintended bias","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0021"}]

description: Skepticism of the Mental Health Industry. This theme details a critical view of psychiatry and psychology as profit-driven enterprises rather than curative practices
quotes_json: [{"quote":"The mental health industry organizes, manages, and assumes business risks to innovate and expand its reach","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0022"},{"quote":"Psychiatrists are never required to cure anyone","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0022"}]

description: Concerns about Foreign National Access to Health Data. This theme addresses national security concerns about non-US citizens having access to protected health information
quotes_json: [{"quote":"Non-American citizens should not be granted access to protected health information (PHI)","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0082"},{"quote":"Over 90% of CHCC’s medical staff are foreign nationals/non-American citizens","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0082"}]

description: Specific Clinical and Care Delivery Models. This theme covers comments focused on improving specific types of care delivery or clinical specialty areas through technology and policy
quotes_json: [{"quote":"Telehealth and telemedicine services should remain available to the public","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0033"},{"quote":"The CMS TEAM (Transforming Episode Accountability Model) should be mandated, not voluntary","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0282"}]

description: Telehealth. This theme includes all comments related to the provision of healthcare services remotely via telecommunications technology
quotes_json: [{"quote":"Requests that telehealth coverage be continued after September","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0006"},{"quote":"I hope CMS and the government will continue to support and further expand telehealth appointments for Medicare patients","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0036"}]

description: Strong Support for Permanent Telehealth Coverage. This theme captures the numerous calls to make pandemic-era telehealth flexibilities permanent
quotes_json: [{"quote":"The Medicare Telehealth benefit, which is set to expire on September 30, 2025, should be made a permanent benefit for seniors and disabled Americans","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0052"},{"quote":"It helps reduce exposure to other sick patients in doctor's office waiting rooms","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0033"}]

description: Concerns about Telehealth Quality and Misdiagnosis. This theme addresses the potential downsides and risks of telehealth, including insufficient care and misdiagnosis
quotes_json: [{"quote":"Disagrees with the emphasis CMS places on telehealth, arguing it leads to insufficient care rather than enhancing it","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0038"},{"quote":"If the commenter had followed the telehealth provider's advice, they would have taken unnecessary antibiotics","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0038"}]

description: Calls to Make Specific Flexibilities Permanent. This theme details requests to make specific pandemic-era telehealth rules permanent, such as virtual supervision and address flexibility
quotes_json: [{"quote":"Permanently Allow Telehealth Providers to Use Practice Address (Not Personal) for Billing and Enrollment","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0272"},{"quote":"Make Direct Virtual Supervision via Telehealth Permanent For All Scenarios","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0272"}]

description: Post-Acute and Home-Based Care. This theme focuses on the unique technology needs and barriers in skilled nursing, home health, and hospice settings
quotes_json: [{"quote":"Current federal regulations are designed for episodic, fee-for-service care, not the variable, relationship-driven environment of SNFs","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0030"},{"quote":"Adoption of interoperable health information technology (HIT) in post-acute care...lags far behind acute and ambulatory sectors","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0274"}]

description: Barriers to Technology Adoption in Post-Acute Care. This theme describes the specific challenges, such as underfunding and lack of interoperability, faced by SNFs
quotes_json: [{"quote":"Include SNFs in future funding for EHR upgrades, real-time data sharing tools, and care coordination platforms","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0030"},{"quote":"Invite SNF leaders, frontline clinicians, and other post-acute partners to join CMS advisory and pilot program design teams","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0030"}]

description: Barriers to Technology Adoption in Home Health. This theme covers the resource and infrastructure challenges faced by home health and hospice providers
quotes_json: [{"quote":"Effective, real-time data exchange is critical for coordinated, high-quality patient care, but home-based providers lack the financial and technical resources","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0274"},{"quote":"Home health agencies were excluded from federal investments under the 2009 Health Information Technology for Economic and Clinical Health (HITECH) Act","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0274"}]

description: Proposal for Hospital-at-Home (HaH) Model Support. This theme describes a proposal to convene a working group to study and advance the Hospital-at-Home care model
quotes_json: [{"quote":"Hospital-at-Home (HaH) has the potential to improve patient outcomes, enhance patient experience, and reduce costs","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0141"},{"quote":"Proposes leveraging this existing working group to organize a one-day symposium titled 'Hospital-at-Home: Challenges and Solutions.'","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0141"}]

description: Specific Clinical Specialties and Conditions. This theme groups comments focused on the technological needs and issues within specific medical specialties or for certain diseases
quotes_json: [{"quote":"The clinical effectiveness of many neurology-relevant wearables (for stroke, migraine, epilepsy, etc.) has not been widely studied or demonstrated","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0159"},{"quote":"The AAAAI urges CMS and ASTP to take action to address the inaccurate and persistent labeling of penicillin allergy in the electronic health record (EHR)","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0138"}]

description: Improving Penicillin Allergy Documentation in EHRs. This theme addresses the problem of inaccurate penicillin allergy labels and proposes modernizing EHRs to better manage this data
quotes_json: [{"quote":"While about 10% of the U.S. population reports a penicillin allergy, over 90% of these individuals are not truly allergic","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0138"},{"quote":"EHRs should shift from static allergy labels to a dynamic, understandable, and actionable 'alert-based' model","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0138"}]

description: Needs of Neurology and Neurological Data. This theme covers the specific data exchange and technology challenges faced in the field of neurology
quotes_json: [{"quote":"Concerned about the open API disclosure of highly sensitive patient data, such as genetic test results for incurable neurodegenerative diseases (e.g., Huntington's)","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0159"},{"quote":"Expand the exception to permit organization-wide policies that delay the release of results for terminal or other highly sensitive tests","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0159"}]

description: Needs of Cardiothoracic Surgery Registries. This theme focuses on the need for clinical data registries, like the STS National Database, to have better access to federal claims data
quotes_json: [{"quote":"It is critical for registries to supplement their clinical data with federal claims data to assess the impact of interventions over extended periods","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0103"},{"quote":"A key barrier to access is the Virtual Research Data Center (VRDC) [which] is slow, complex, and prohibitively expensive","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0103"}]

description: Needs of Spinal Fusion Care Episodes. This theme addresses the argument that payment model episodes for spinal fusion are too short and should be extended
quotes_json: [{"quote":"The 90-day episode of care for spinal fusion should be extended to a minimum of 180 days","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0215"},{"quote":"Fusion failure risk is highest between 3-5 months post-operation, a period completely missed by a 90-day window","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0215"}]

description: Needs of Diabetes Care and CGM Technology. This theme focuses on proposals related to continuous glucose monitoring (CGM) technology for diabetes management
quotes_json: [{"quote":"The American Diabetes Association (ADA) recommends CGM for anyone managing diabetes, regardless of insulin use","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0162"},{"quote":"Develop and implement CGM-derived quality measures for patient hypoglycemia and hyperglycemia in the ambulatory setting","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0162"}]

description: Unifying Sepsis Standards and Reporting. This theme describes the lethal misalignment between clinical and payment definitions for sepsis and calls for a unified national standard
quotes_json: [{"quote":"There is a lethal misalignment in sepsis definitions: CMS uses SEP-1...while commercial payers use the more restrictive Sepsis-3 definition to deny claims","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0196"},{"quote":"Mandate a 'One Truth Standard' for sepsis, aligned with SEP-1, across all certified APIs, CDS tools, and payer systems","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0196"}]

description: General Support for RFI and Digital Modernization. This theme captures comments that express general, high-level support for the RFI's goals without offering detailed or distinct recommendations
quotes_json: [{"quote":"Supports the Health Technology Ecosystem RFI, stating that modernizing digital health infrastructure and data interoperability is essential for improving healthcare access, efficiency, and patient outcomes","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0146"},{"quote":"Appreciates the continual updates provided by the agency on the system and other systematic instructions/compliance","comment_id":"CMS-2025-0050-0105"}]
